intro: Triadenum breviflorum, commonly known as the short-flowered triadenum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Triadenum breviflorum is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
